poem:
### The Paradox of Cleanliness

Between the lines of daily dust,  
our threads whisper secrets,  
worn messages of use, candor  
cloaked in the mundane. Spin,  
rinse away the kindness of wear.  
It is in this ritual of renewal—  
water and time entangled—  
that we seek purity,  
yet find only the cycle  
of wanting for more.
